page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The area commences at Fforest Goch, a small hamlel behind which is the 1350 ft. March Hywel Mountain. Rhos. A small village containing a chapel, school and a few shops. One mile from Rhos is the hamlet of Cilybebyll where the church carries a 12th. Century tower and 15th. Century bell. The main road winds down into Pontardawe whilst a subsidiary road curves over the mountain (Graig), passing an old quarry, public houses, a rugby club and chapel, to the centre of Alltwen called the Triangle, then downwards into Pontardawe (Bridge on the Tawe).Alltwen lies on a west facing hill overlooking the River Tawe. A new road bridge leads to the small town of Pontardawe containing an industrial estate, a health centre, numerous shops and a leisure centre.
